info.title: AT Protocol XRPC API
info.summary: Conversion of AT Protocol's lexicons to OpenAPI's schema format.
info.description: This section contains HTTP API reference docs for Bluesky and AT Protocol lexicons. Generate a bearer token to test API calls directly from the docs.

get.description:
*This endpoint is part of the Bluesky application Lexicon APIs (`app.bsky.*`). Public endpoints which don't require authentication can be made directly against the public Bluesky AppView API: https://public.api.bsky.app. Authenticated requests are usually made to the user's PDS, with automatic service proxying. Authenticated requests can be used for both public and non-public endpoints.*

*To learn more about calling atproto API endpoints like this one, see the [API Hosts and Auth](/docs/advanced-guides/api-directory) guide.*

Get private preferences attached to the current account. Expected use is synchronization between multiple devices, and import/export during account migration. Requires auth.

Authenticated requests can be used for both public and non-public endpoints.*

*To learn more about calling atproto API endpoints like this one, see the [API Hosts and Auth](/docs/advanced-guides/api-directory) guide.*

Get detailed profile view of an actor. Does not require auth, but contains relevant metadata with auth.

parameters.name: actor
parameters.description: Handle or DID of account to fetch profile of.

schema.description: Handle or DID of account to fetch profile of.

Find posts matching search criteria, returning views of those posts. Note that this API endpoint may require authentication (eg, not public) for some service providers and implementations.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search query string; syntax, phrase, boolean, and faceting is unspecified, but Lucene query syntax is recommended.

schema.description: Search query string; syntax, phrase, boolean, and faceting is unspecified, but Lucene query syntax is recommended.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies the ranking order of results.

schema.description: Specifies the ranking order of results.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Filter results for posts after the indicated datetime (inclusive). Expected to use 'sortAt' timestamp, which may not match 'createdAt'. Can be a datetime, or just an ISO date (YYYY-MM-DD).

schema.description: Filter results for posts after the indicated datetime (inclusive). Expected to use 'sortAt' timestamp, which may not match 'createdAt'. Can be a datetime, or just an ISO date (YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Filter results for posts before the indicated datetime (not inclusive). Expected to use 'sortAt' timestamp, which may not match 'createdAt'. Can be a datetime, or just an ISO date (YYY-MM-DD).

schema.description: Filter results for posts before the indicated datetime (not inclusive). Expected to use 'sortAt' timestamp, which may not match 'createdAt'. Can be a datetime, or just an ISO date (YYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: mentions
parameters.description: Filter to posts which mention the given account. Handles are resolved to DID before query-time. Only matches rich-text facet mentions.

schema.description: Filter to posts which mention the given account. Handles are resolved to DID before query-time. Only matches rich-text facet mentions.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Filter to posts by the given account. Handles are resolved to DID before query-time.

schema.description: Filter to posts by the given account. Handles are resolved to DID before query-time.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: Filter to posts in the given language. Expected to be based on post language field, though server may override language detection.

schema.description: Filter to posts in the given language. Expected to be based on post language field, though server may override language detection.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Filter to posts with URLs (facet links or embeds) linking to the given domain (hostname). Server may apply hostname normalization.

schema.description: Filter to posts with URLs (facet links or embeds) linking to the given domain (hostname). Server may apply hostname normalization.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Filter to posts with links (facet links or embeds) pointing to this URL. Server may apply URL normalization or fuzzy matching.

schema.description: Filter to posts with links (facet links or embeds) pointing to this URL. Server may apply URL normalization or fuzzy matching.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Filter to posts with the given tag (hashtag), based on rich-text facet or tag field. Do not include the hash (#) prefix. Multiple tags can be specified, with 'AND' matching.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Optional pagination mechanism; may not necessarily allow scrolling through entire result set.

schema.description: Optional pagination mechanism; may not necessarily allow scrolling through entire result set.

parameters.description: Sort direction for the events. Defaults to descending order of created at timestamp.

schema.description: Sort direction for the events. Defaults to descending order of created at timestamp.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Retrieve events created after a given timestamp

schema.description: Retrieve events created after a given timestamp

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Retrieve events created before a given timestamp

schema.description: Retrieve events created before a given timestamp

parameters.name: collections
parameters.description: If specified, only events where the subject belongs to the given collections will be returned. When subjectType is set to 'account', this will be ignored.

parameters.name: subjectType
parameters.description: If specified, only events where the subject is of the given type (account or record) will be returned. When this is set to 'account' the 'collections' parameter will be ignored. When includeAllUserRecords or subject is set, this will be ignored.

schema.description: If specified, only events where the subject is of the given type (account or record) will be returned. When this is set to 'account' the 'collections' parameter will be ignored. When includeAllUserRecords or subject is set, this will be ignored.

parameters.name: includeAllUserRecords
parameters.description: If true, events on all record types (posts, lists, profile etc.) or records from given 'collections' param, owned by the did are returned.

schema.description: If true, events on all record types (posts, lists, profile etc.) or records from given 'collections' param, owned by the did are returned.

parameters.name: hasComment
parameters.description: If true, only events with comments are returned

schema.description: If true, only events with comments are returned

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: If specified, only events with comments containing the keyword are returned. Apply || separator to use multiple keywords and match using OR condition.

schema.description: If specified, only events with comments containing the keyword are returned. Apply || separator to use multiple keywords and match using OR condition.

parameters.name: addedLabels
parameters.description: If specified, only events where all of these labels were added are returned

parameters.name: removedLabels
parameters.description: If specified, only events where all of these labels were removed are returned

parameters.name: addedTags
parameters.description: If specified, only events where all of these tags were added are returned

parameters.name: removedTags
parameters.description: If specified, only events where all of these tags were removed are returned

items.description: If specified, only events where the action policies match any of the given policies are returned

parameters.name: modTool
parameters.description: If specified, only events where the modTool name matches any of the given values are returned

parameters.name: batchId
parameters.description: If specified, only events where the batchId matches the given value are returned

schema.description: If specified, only events where the batchId matches the given value are returned

parameters.name: ageAssuranceState
parameters.description: If specified, only events where the age assurance state matches the given value are returned

schema.description: If specified, only events where the age assurance state matches the given value are returned

parameters.name: withStrike
parameters.description: If specified, only events where strikeCount value is set are returned.

schema.description: If specified, only events where strikeCount value is set are returned.

schema.description: A seeder to shuffle/balance the queue items.

parameters.name: includeAllUserRecords
parameters.description: All subjects, or subjects from given 'collections' param, belonging to the account specified in the 'subject' param will be returned.

schema.description: All subjects, or subjects from given 'collections' param, belonging to the account specified in the 'subject' param will be returned.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The subject to get the status for.

schema.description: The subject to get the status for.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Search subjects by keyword from comments

schema.description: Search subjects by keyword from comments

parameters.name: reportedAfter
parameters.description: Search subjects reported after a given timestamp

schema.description: Search subjects reported after a given timestamp

parameters.name: reportedBefore
parameters.description: Search subjects reported before a given timestamp

schema.description: Search subjects reported before a given timestamp

parameters.name: reviewedAfter
parameters.description: Search subjects reviewed after a given timestamp

schema.description: Search subjects reviewed after a given timestamp

parameters.name: hostingDeletedAfter
parameters.description: Search subjects where the associated record/account was deleted after a given timestamp

schema.description: Search subjects where the associated record/account was deleted after a given timestamp

parameters.name: hostingDeletedBefore
parameters.description: Search subjects where the associated record/account was deleted before a given timestamp

schema.description: Search subjects where the associated record/account was deleted before a given timestamp

parameters.name: hostingUpdatedAfter
parameters.description: Search subjects where the associated record/account was updated after a given timestamp

schema.description: Search subjects where the associated record/account was updated after a given timestamp

parameters.name: hostingUpdatedBefore
parameters.description: Search subjects where the associated record/account was updated before a given timestamp

schema.description: Search subjects where the associated record/account was updated before a given timestamp

parameters.name: hostingStatuses
parameters.description: Search subjects by the status of the associated record/account

parameters.name: reviewedBefore
parameters.description: Search subjects reviewed before a given timestamp

schema.description: Search subjects reviewed before a given timestamp

parameters.name: includeMuted
parameters.description: By default, we don't include muted subjects in the results. Set this to true to include them.

schema.description: By default, we don't include muted subjects in the results. Set this to true to include them.

parameters.name: onlyMuted
parameters.description: When set to true, only muted subjects and reporters will be returned.

schema.description: When set to true, only muted subjects and reporters will be returned.

parameters.name: reviewState
parameters.description: Specify when fetching subjects in a certain state

schema.description: Specify when fetching subjects in a certain state

parameters.name: lastReviewedBy
parameters.description: Get all subject statuses that were reviewed by a specific moderator

schema.description: Get all subject statuses that were reviewed by a specific moderator

parameters.name: takendown
parameters.description: Get subjects that were taken down

schema.description: Get subjects that were taken down

parameters.name: appealed
parameters.description: Get subjects in unresolved appealed status

schema.description: Get subjects in unresolved appealed status

items.description: Items in this array are applied with OR filters. To apply AND filter, put all tags in the same string and separate using && characters

parameters.name: collections
parameters.description: If specified, subjects belonging to the given collections will be returned. When subjectType is set to 'account', this will be ignored.

parameters.name: subjectType
parameters.description: If specified, subjects of the given type (account or record) will be returned. When this is set to 'account' the 'collections' parameter will be ignored. When includeAllUserRecords or subject is set, this will be ignored.

schema.description: If specified, subjects of the given type (account or record) will be returned. When this is set to 'account' the 'collections' parameter will be ignored. When includeAllUserRecords or subject is set, this will be ignored.

parameters.name: minAccountSuspendCount
parameters.description: If specified, only subjects that belong to an account that has at least this many suspensions will be returned.

parameters.name: minReportedRecordsCount
parameters.description: If specified, only subjects that belong to an account that has at least this many reported records will be returned.

parameters.name: minTakendownRecordsCount
parameters.description: If specified, only subjects that belong to an account that has at least this many taken down records will be returned.

parameters.name: minPriorityScore
parameters.description: If specified, only subjects that have priority score value above the given value will be returned.

parameters.name: minStrikeCount
parameters.description: If specified, only subjects that belong to an account that has at least this many active strikes will be returned.

parameters.name: ageAssuranceState
parameters.description: If specified, only subjects with the given age assurance state will be returned.

schema.description: If specified, only subjects with the given age assurance state will be returned.

Indices are zero-indexed, counting bytes of the UTF-8 encoded text. NOTE: some languages, like Javascript, use UTF-16 or Unicode codepoints for string slice indexing; in these languages, convert to byte arrays before working with facets.

src.description: DID of the actor who created this label.

uri.description: AT URI of the record, repository (account), or other resource that this label applies to.

cid.description: Optionally, CID specifying the specific version of 'uri' resource this label applies to.

val.description: The short string name of the value or type of this label.

neg.description: If true, this is a negation label, overwriting a previous label.

cts.description: Timestamp when this label was created.

exp.description: Timestamp at which this label expires (no longer applies).

com.atproto.label.defs.selfLabels.description: Metadata tags on an atproto record, published by the author within the record.

com.atproto.label.defs.selfLabel.description: Metadata tag on an atproto record, published by the author within the record. Note that schemas should use #selfLabels, not #selfLabel.

val.description: The short string name of the value or type of this label.

com.atproto.label.defs.labelValueDefinit.description: Declares a label value and its expected interpretations and behaviors.

identifier.description: The value of the label being defined. Must only include lowercase ascii and the '-' character ([a-z-]+).

severity.description: How should a client visually convey this label? 'inform' means neutral and informational; 'alert' means negative and warning; 'none' means show nothing.

blurs.description: What should this label hide in the UI, if applied? 'content' hides all of the target; 'media' hides the images/video/audio; 'none' hides nothing.

defaultSetting.description: The default setting for this label.

adultOnly.description: Does the user need to have adult content enabled in order to configure this label?

com.atproto.label.defs.labelValueDefinit.description: Strings which describe the label in the UI, localized into a specific language.

lang.description: The code of the language these strings are written in.

name.description: A short human-readable name for the label.

description.description: A longer description of what the label means and why it might be applied.

com.atproto.moderation.defs.reasonViolat.description: Direct violation of server rules, laws, terms of service. Prefer new lexicon definition `tools.ozone.report.defs#reasonRuleOther`.

com.atproto.moderation.defs.subjectType.description: Tag describing a type of subject that might be reported.

com.atproto.repo.applyWrites.update.description: Operation which updates an existing record.

com.atproto.repo.applyWrites.delete.description: Operation which deletes an existing record.

hostname.description: hostname of server; not a URL (no scheme)

status.description: If active=false, this optional field indicates a possible reason for why the account is not active. If active=false and no status is supplied, then the host makes no claim for why the repository is no longer being hosted.

com.atproto.sync.subscribeRepos.commit.description: Represents an update of repository state. Note that empty commits are allowed, which include no repo data changes, but an update to rev and signature.

repo.description: The repo this event comes from. Note that all other message types name this field 'did'.

rev.description: The rev of the emitted commit. Note that this information is also in the commit object included in blocks, unless this is a tooBig event.

since.description: The rev of the last emitted commit from this repo (if any).

blocks.description: CAR file containing relevant blocks, as a diff since the previous repo state. The commit must be included as a block, and the commit block CID must be the first entry in the CAR header 'roots' list.

time.description: Timestamp of when this message was originally broadcast.

com.atproto.sync.subscribeRepos.sync.description: Updates the repo to a new state, without necessarily including that state on the firehose. Used to recover from broken commit streams, data loss incidents, or in situations where upstream host does not know recent state of the repository.

did.description: The account this repo event corresponds to. Must match that in the commit object.

blocks.description: CAR file containing the commit, as a block. The CAR header must include the commit block CID as the first 'root'.

rev.description: The rev of the commit. This value must match that in the commit object.

time.description: Timestamp of when this message was originally broadcast.

com.atproto.sync.subscribeRepos.identity.description: Represents a change to an account's identity. Could be an updated handle, signing key, or pds hosting endpoint. Serves as a prod to all downstream services to refresh their identity cache.

handle.description: The current handle for the account, or 'handle.invalid' if validation fails. This field is optional, might have been validated or passed-through from an upstream source. Semantics and behaviors for PDS vs Relay may evolve in the future; see atproto specs for more details.

com.atproto.sync.subscribeRepos.account.description: Represents a change to an account's status on a host (eg, PDS or Relay). The semantics of this event are that the status is at the host which emitted the event, not necessarily that at the currently active PDS. Eg, a Relay takedown would emit a takedown with active=false, even if the PDS is still active.

active.description: Indicates that the account has a repository which can be fetched from the host that emitted this event.

status.description: If active=false, this optional field indicates a reason for why the account is not active.

com.atproto.sync.subscribeRepos.repoOp.description: A repo operation, ie a mutation of a single record.

tools.ozone.moderation.defs.modEventDive.description: Divert a record's blobs to a 3rd party service for further scanning/tagging

tools.ozone.moderation.defs.modEventTag.description: Add/Remove a tag on a subject

tools.ozone.moderation.defs.accountEvent.description: Logs account status related events on a repo subject. Normally captured by automod from the firehose and emitted to ozone for historical tracking.

active.description: Indicates that the account has a repository which can be fetched from the host that emitted this event.

tools.ozone.moderation.defs.identityEven.description: Logs identity related events on a repo subject. Normally captured by automod from the firehose and emitted to ozone for historical tracking.

tools.ozone.moderation.defs.recordEvent.description: Logs lifecycle event on a record subject. Normally captured by automod from the firehose and emitted to ozone for historical tracking.

tools.ozone.moderation.defs.scheduleTake.description: Logs a scheduled takedown action for an account.

tools.ozone.moderation.defs.cancelSchedu.description: Logs cancellation of a scheduled takedown action for an account.

tools.ozone.moderation.defs.modTool.description: Moderation tool information for tracing the source of the action

tools.ozone.moderation.defs.timelineEven.description: Moderation event timeline event for a PLC create operation
Moderation event timeline event for generic PLC operation
Moderation event timeline event for a PLC tombstone operation

tools.ozone.moderation.defs.scheduledAct.description: View of a scheduled moderation action

action.description: Type of action to be executed

executeAt.description: Exact time to execute the action

executeAfter.description: Earliest time to execute the action (for randomized scheduling)

executeUntil.description: Latest time to execute the action (for randomized scheduling)

randomizeExecution.description: Whether execution time should be randomized within the specified range

createdBy.description: DID of the user who created this scheduled action

createdAt.description: When the scheduled action was created

updatedAt.description: When the scheduled action was last updated

status.description: Current status of the scheduled action

lastExecutedAt.description: When the action was last attempted to be executed

lastFailureReason.description: Reason for the last execution failure

acknowledgeAccountSubjects.description: If true, all other reports on content authored by this account will be resolved (acknowledged).

severityLevel.description: Severity level of the violation (e.g., 'sev-0', 'sev-1', 'sev-2', etc.).

strikeExpiresAt.description: When the strike should expire. If not provided, the strike never expires.

emailContent.description: Email content to be sent to the user upon takedown.

emailSubject.description: Subject of the email to be sent to the user upon takedown.

tools.ozone.moderation.scheduleAction.sc.description: Configuration for when the action should be executed

executeAt.description: Exact time to execute the action

executeAfter.description: Earliest time to execute the action (for randomized scheduling)

executeUntil.description: Latest time to execute the action (for randomized scheduling)

tools.ozone.report.defs.reasonAppeal.description: Appeal a previously taken moderation action

tools.ozone.report.defs.reasonOther.description: An issue not included in these options

tools.ozone.report.defs.reasonViolenceEx.description: Extremist content. These reports will be sent only be sent to the application's Moderation Authority.

Grooming or predatory behavior. These reports will be sent only be sent to the application's Moderation Authority.
Other child safety. These reports will be sent only be sent to the application's Moderation Authority.

tools.ozone.report.defs.reasonRuleProhib.description: Promoting or selling prohibited items or services

tools.ozone.safelink.defs.event.description: An event for URL safety decisions

url.description: The URL that this rule applies to

createdBy.description: DID of the user who created this rule

tools.ozone.safelink.defs.urlRule.description: Input for creating a URL safety rule

url.description: The URL or domain to apply the rule to

createdBy.description: DID of the user added the rule.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the rule was created

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the rule was last updated

tools.ozone.team.defs.roleAdmin.description: Admin role. Highest level of access, can perform all actions.

tools.ozone.team.defs.roleModerator.description: Moderator role. Can perform most actions.

tools.ozone.team.defs.roleTriage.description: Triage role. Mostly intended for monitoring and escalating issues.

tools.ozone.team.defs.roleVerifier.description: Verifier role. Only allowed to issue verifications.

tools.ozone.verification.defs.verificati.description: Verification data for the associated subject.

issuer.description: The user who issued this verification.

uri.description: The AT-URI of the verification record.

handle.description: Handle of the subject the verification applies to at the moment of verifying, which might not be the same at the time of viewing. The verification is only valid if the current handle matches the one at the time of verifying.

displayName.description: Display name of the subject the verification applies to at the moment of verifying, which might not be the same at the time of viewing. The verification is only valid if the current displayName matches the one at the time of verifying.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the verification was created.

revokeReason.description: Describes the reason for revocation, also indicating that the verification is no longer valid.

revokedAt.description: Timestamp when the verification was revoked.

revokedBy.description: The user who revoked this verification.

subject.description: The did of the subject being verified

handle.description: Handle of the subject the verification applies to at the moment of verifying.

displayName.description: Display name of the subject the verification applies to at the moment of verifying.

createdAt.description: Timestamp for verification record. Defaults to current time when not specified.

error.description: Error message describing the reason for failure.

subject.description: The did of the subject being verified

uri.description: The AT-URI of the verification record that failed to revoke.

error.description: Description of the error that occurred during revocation.
